title: Board President using HOA funds for attorney fees against restraining order.
question: Situation: A homeowner who serves as our Secretary (Plaintiff) has filed a Civil Harassment suit against another homeowner who serves as our President (Defendant). The court has already granted Plaintiff a temporary restraining order (TRO) against Defendant. TRO is currently in effect. Court date is set in a few weeks to determine if TRO turns permanent.
question_tags: Business contracts,Small business taxes,Small business income tax,Business liability,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Residential property,HOA disputes,Homeowners' association,Business,Criminal charges for harassment,Restraining order and criminal defense,Gift tax,Lawsuits and disputes,Tax law,Fees
answers:
1. The board of directors has to approve the payments and the hiring of the attorney. One problem with the Board approval is that the directors involved can not be recused because there would not be a majority vote without them. So did the board authorize the hiring of the attorney? Get a copy of the minutes of the meeting authorizing this.
2. Do your CC&Rs authorize the indemnification of the directors in this case?
3. I believe, off the top of my head, a Special Meeting of the Homeowners has to be called to trump the board of directors.
4. Contact the attorney handling the matter and tell him that there is a conflict of interest because HOA money is being used. Tell the attorney the HOA will seek a refund.

Now it sounds like you have a small association so you can get this done but you will need an attorney. The hiring of a attorney will have to be approved at the Special Meeting of Homeowners.

It's fpr a breach of fiduciary duty for a board member to use HOA money to pay for personal debts.

Are you sure the dispute has nothing to do with HOA business? The HOA very likely indemnifies board members for Board business liabilities, which would include this. The lawyer has surely reviewed yoru HOA's CC&Rs to see what kind of indemnity a board member is entitled to - have you?
